recipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.author: John Smith
instructions: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned.
Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, oregano, basil.
Simmer the sauce for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Serve the sauce over cooked spaghetti.

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.author: Emily Johnson
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, Parmesan cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, mustard.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Add croutons to the salad and season with salt and pepper.
Serve the Caesar salad immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken Stir-Fry
recipes.author: Jessica Adams
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add chicken slices to the skillet and cook until browned.
Add bell pepper, carrot, broccoli, snap peas, and minced garlic.
Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken andvegetables in the skillet.
Stir-fry for a few minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients.
Serve the chicken stir-fry hot over steamed rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Margherita Pizza
recipes.author: Michael Brown
instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C) and place a pizza stone in the oven.
Roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border.
Arrange sliced mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and season with salt and pepper.
Bake the pizza on the preheated pizza stone for 10-12 minutes.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and slice before serving.

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.author: Sarah Davis
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a loaf pan.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter and granulated sugar.
Add eggs, mashed bananas, yogurt, and vanilla extract to the butter mixture.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.
Fold in chopped walnuts if desired.
Pour the batter into the greased loaf pan and smooth the top.
Bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the banana bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

recipes.title: Jollof Rice
recipes.author: Amina Ibrahim
instructions: Wash the rice thoroughly and set aside.
In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped red and green bell peppers and cook until softened.
Stir in diced tomatoes and tomato paste, and cook for a few minutes.
Add rice, chicken or vegetable broth, curry powder, thyme, paprika, and cayenne pepper.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from heat and let the Jollof Rice rest for 5 minutes before fluffing it with a fork.
Serve the Jollof Rice as a main dish or as a side with your favorite protein.
